name: CustomUnfurlSlackUrls
description:
Provide custom unfurl behavior for user-posted URLs on Slack.

This tool should be called to customize how URLs posted by users are displayed in Slack by providing a custom unfurl behavior.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: ID of the Slack channel where the message is posted. Required with 'ts' for custom unfurl or with 'unfurl_id' and 'source'.

parameters.name: message_timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp of the message to which unfurl behavior will be added. Ensure it corresponds to a message in the specified channel containing a fully-qualified URL registered with your Slack app.

parameters.name: unfurl_url_map
parameters.description: A URL-encoded JSON map with URLs as keys and their corresponding unfurl data as values. Each URL should point to a single attachment, like message buttons.

parameters.name: authentication_invitation_message
parameters.description: A simple formatted string sent as an ephemeral message inviting the user to authenticate for full unfurl behavior. Supports Slack's *bold*, _italics_, and linking formatting. If provided, this takes precedence over `authentication_invitation_url`.

parameters.name: custom_authentication_url
parameters.description: A URL to redirect users for app authentication to enable full URL unfurling, requires URL encoding.

parameters.name: user_authentication_blocks
parameters.description: A URL-encoded JSON array of structured blocks to send as an ephemeral message for user authentication invitation.

parameters.name: unfurl_link_id
parameters.description: The ID of the link to unfurl. Must be used with 'source'.

parameters.name: link_source
parameters.description: Specify the source of the link to unfurl as either 'composer' for links inside the message composer or 'conversations_history' for links posted to a conversation. Must be used with 'unfurl_id', or alternatively with 'channel' and 'ts'.

parameters.name: require_user_authentication
parameters.description: Set to true if the user must install your Slack app to trigger unfurls for this domain.

metadata.description: Arcade Wrapper Tools enabling LLMs to interact with low-level Slack API endpoints.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Channel ID of the message. Both `channel` and `ts` must be provided together, or `unfurl_id` and `source` must be provided together.

parameters.name: ts
parameters.description: Timestamp of the message to add unfurl behavior to.

parameters.name: unfurls
parameters.description: URL-encoded JSON map with keys set to URLs featured in the message, pointing to their unfurl blocks or message attachments.

parameters.name: user_auth_message
parameters.description: Provide a simply-formatted string to send as an ephemeral message to the user as invitation to authenticate further and enable full unfurling behavior. Provides two buttons, `Not now` or `Never ask me again`.

parameters.name: user_auth_required
parameters.description: Set to `true` or `1` to indicate the user must install your Slack app to trigger unfurls for this domain.

parameters.name: user_auth_url
parameters.description: Send users to this custom URL where they will complete authentication in your app to fully trigger unfurling. Value should be properly URL-encoded.

parameters.name: user_auth_blocks
parameters.description: Provide a JSON based array of structured blocks presented as URL-encoded string to send as an ephemeral message to the user as invitation to authenticate further and enable full unfurling behavior

parameters.name: unfurl_id
parameters.description: The ID of the link to unfurl. Both `unfurl_id` and `source` must be provided together, or `channel` and `ts` must be provided together.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source of the link to unfurl. The source may either be `composer`, when the link is inside the message composer, or `conversations_history`, when the link has been posted to a conversation.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
